1211.SR.summary: Saudi Arabian Mining Company (Ma'aden), together with its subsidiaries, operates as a multi-commodity mining company in the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia and internationally. It operates through Phosphate, Aluminium, and Precious and Base Metals segments. The company primarily mines for gold, phosphate rock, bauxite, low-grade bauxite, kaolin, and magnesite, as well as copper, zinc, and silver concentrates. It principally holds interests in the Mahd Ad-Dahab, Bulghah, Al-Amar, Sukhaybarat, As Suq, Ad Duwayhi, Al-Jalamid, Al-Khabra, Az Zabirah, Al-Ghazallah, and Al-Ba'itha mines. The company also produces aluminum ingots, T-shape ingots, slabs, sheets, and billets; and urea, phosphate, and potassium fertilizer, as well as manages and develops infrastructure projects. Saudi Arabian Mining Company (Ma'aden) was founded in 1997 and is based in Riyadh, the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia.
